verses.verseString: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ
verses.verseStringB: In the name of Allah, the Compassionate, the Merciful.

verses.verseString: طه
verses.verseStringB: Ta. Ha.

verses.verseString: مَا أَنْزَلْنَا عَلَيْكَ الْقُرْآنَ لِتَشْقَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: We did not reveal the Quran to you to make you suffer.

verses.verseString: إِلَّا تَذْكِرَةً لِمَنْ يَخْشَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: But only as a reminder for him who fears.

verses.verseString: تَنْزِيلًا مِمَّنْ خَلَقَ الْأَرْضَ وَالسَّمَاوَاتِ الْعُلَى
verses.verseStringB: A revelation from He Who created the earth and the high heavens.

verses.verseString: الرَّحْمَٰنُ عَلَى الْعَرْشِ اسْتَوَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: The Mercy-Giver; on the Throne He settled.

verses.verseString: لَهُ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا وَمَا تَحْتَ الثَّرَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: To Him belongs everything in the heavens, everything on earth, everything between them, and everything beneath the soil.

verses.verseString: وَإِنْ تَجْهَرْ بِالْقَوْلِ فَإِنَّهُ يَعْلَمُ السِّرَّ وَأَخْفَى
verses.verseStringB: If you speak aloud—He knows the secret, and what is more hidden.

verses.verseString: اللَّهُ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۖ لَهُ الْأَسْمَاءُ الْحُسْنَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Allah—there is no god except He. He has the Most Beautiful Names.

verses.verseString: وَهَلْ أَتَاكَ حَدِيثُ مُوسَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Has the story of Moses reached you?

verses.verseString: إِذْ رَأَىٰ نَارًا فَقَالَ لِأَهْلِهِ امْكُثُوا إِنِّي آنَسْتُ نَارًا لَعَلِّي آتِيكُمْ مِنْهَا بِقَبَسٍ أَوْ أَجِدُ عَلَى النَّارِ هُدًى
verses.verseStringB: When he saw a fire, he said to his family, “Stay; I have noticed a fire; perhaps I can bring you a torch from it, or find guidance at the fire.”

verses.verseString: فَلَمَّا أَتَاهَا نُودِيَ يَا مُوسَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Then, when he reached it, he was called: “O Moses!

verses.verseString: إِنِّي أَنَا رَبُّكَ فَاخْلَعْ نَعْلَيْكَ ۖ إِنَّكَ بِالْوَادِ الْمُقَدَّسِ طُوًى
verses.verseStringB: I. I am your Lord. Take off your sandals. You are in the sacred valley of Tuwa.

verses.verseString: وَأَنَا اخْتَرْتُكَ فَاسْتَمِعْ لِمَا يُوحَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And I have chosen you, so listen to what is revealed.

verses.verseString: إِنَّنِي أَنَا اللَّهُ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا أَنَا فَاعْبُدْنِي وَأَقِمِ الصَّلَاةَ لِذِكْرِي
verses.verseStringB: I. I am Allah. There is no God except Me. So serve Me, and practice the prayer for My remembrance.

verses.verseString: إِنَّ السَّاعَةَ آتِيَةٌ أَكَادُ أُخْفِيهَا لِتُجْزَىٰ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ بِمَا تَسْعَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: The Hour is coming. But I keep it almost hidden, so that every soul is rewarded by what it endeavors.

verses.verseString: فَلَا يَصُدَّنَّكَ عَنْهَا مَنْ لَا يُؤْمِنُ بِهَا وَاتَّبَعَ هَوَاهُ فَتَرْدَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And do not let him who denies it and follows his desire turn you away from it, or you will fall.

verses.verseString: وَمَا تِلْكَ بِيَمِينِكَ يَا مُوسَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And what is that in your right hand, O Moses?”

verses.verseString: قَالَ هِيَ عَصَايَ أَتَوَكَّأُ عَلَيْهَا وَأَهُشُّ بِهَا عَلَىٰ غَنَمِي وَلِيَ فِيهَا مَآرِبُ أُخْرَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “It is my cane. I lean on it, and I herd my sheep with it, and I have other uses for it.”

verses.verseString: قَالَ أَلْقِهَا يَا مُوسَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “Throw it, O Moses.”

verses.verseString: فَأَلْقَاهَا فَإِذَا هِيَ حَيَّةٌ تَسْعَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: So he threw it—and it was a serpent, moving swiftly.

verses.verseString: قَالَ خُذْهَا وَلَا تَخَفْ ۖ سَنُعِيدُهَا سِيرَتَهَا الْأُولَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “Take hold of it, and do not fear. We will restore it to its original condition.

verses.verseString: وَاضْمُمْ يَدَكَ إِلَىٰ جَنَاحِكَ تَخْرُجْ بَيْضَاءَ مِنْ غَيْرِ سُوءٍ آيَةً أُخْرَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And press your hand to your side. It will come out white, without blemish—another sign.

verses.verseString: لِنُرِيَكَ مِنْ آيَاتِنَا الْكُبْرَى
verses.verseStringB: So that We may show you some of Our greatest miracles.

verses.verseString: اذْهَبْ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّهُ طَغَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Go to Pharaoh; he has transgressed.”

verses.verseString: قَالَ رَبِّ اشْرَحْ لِي صَدْرِي
verses.verseStringB: He said, “My Lord, put my heart at ease for me.

verses.verseString: وَيَسِّرْ لِي أَمْرِي
verses.verseStringB: And ease my task for me.

verses.verseString: وَاحْلُلْ عُقْدَةً مِنْ لِسَانِي
verses.verseStringB: And untie the knot from my tongue.

verses.verseString: يَفْقَهُوا قَوْلِي
verses.verseStringB: So that they can understand my speech.

verses.verseString: وَاجْعَلْ لِي وَزِيرًا مِنْ أَهْلِي
verses.verseStringB: And appoint an assistant for me, from my family.

verses.verseString: هَارُونَ أَخِي
verses.verseStringB: Aaron, my brother.

verses.verseString: اشْدُدْ بِهِ أَزْرِي
verses.verseStringB: And strengthen me with him.

verses.verseString: وَأَشْرِكْهُ فِي أَمْرِي
verses.verseStringB: And have him share in my mission.

verses.verseString: كَيْ نُسَبِّحَكَ كَثِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: So that we glorify You much.

verses.verseString: وَنَذْكُرَكَ كَثِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: And remember You much.

verses.verseString: إِنَّكَ كُنْتَ بِنَا بَصِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: You are always watching over us.”

verses.verseString: قَالَ قَدْ أُوتِيتَ سُؤْلَكَ يَا مُوسَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “You are granted your request, O Moses.

verses.verseString: وَلَقَدْ مَنَنَّا عَلَيْكَ مَرَّةً أُخْرَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And We have favored you another time.

verses.verseString: إِذْ أَوْحَيْنَا إِلَىٰ أُمِّكَ مَا يُوحَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: When We inspired your mother with inspiration.

verses.verseString: أَنِ اقْذِفِيهِ فِي التَّابُوتِ فَاقْذِفِيهِ فِي الْيَمِّ فَلْيُلْقِهِ الْيَمُّ بِالسَّاحِلِ يَأْخُذْهُ عَدُوٌّ لِي وَعَدُوٌّ لَهُ ۚ وَأَلْقَيْتُ عَلَيْكَ مَحَبَّةً مِنِّي وَلِتُصْنَعَ عَلَىٰ عَيْنِي
verses.verseStringB: ‘Put him in the chest, then throw it in the river. The river will wash him ashore, where an enemy of Mine and an enemy of his will pick him up.’ And I have bestowed on you love from Me, so that you would be raised under My eye.

verses.verseString: إِذْ تَمْشِي أُخْتُكَ فَتَقُولُ هَلْ أَدُلُّكُمْ عَلَىٰ مَنْ يَكْفُلُهُ ۖ فَرَجَعْنَاكَ إِلَىٰ أُمِّكَ كَيْ تَقَرَّ عَيْنُهَا وَلَا تَحْزَنَ ۚ وَقَتَلْتَ نَفْسًا فَنَجَّيْنَاكَ مِنَ الْغَمِّ وَفَتَنَّاكَ فُتُونًا ۚ فَلَبِثْتَ سِنِينَ فِي أَهْلِ مَدْيَنَ ثُمَّ جِئْتَ عَلَىٰ قَدَرٍ يَا مُوسَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: When your sister walked along, and said, ‘Shall I direct you to someone who will take care of him?' So We returned you to your mother, so that she may be comforted, and not sorrow. And you killed a person, but We saved you from distress, and We tested you thoroughly. And you stayed for years among the people of Median. Then you came back, as destined, O Moses.

verses.verseString: وَاصْطَنَعْتُكَ لِنَفْسِي
verses.verseStringB: And I made you for Myself.

verses.verseString: اذْهَبْ أَنْتَ وَأَخُوكَ بِآيَاتِي وَلَا تَنِيَا فِي ذِكْرِي
verses.verseStringB: Go, you and your brother, with My proofs, and do not neglect My remembrance.

verses.verseString: اذْهَبَا إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّهُ طَغَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Go to Pharaoh. He has tyrannized.

verses.verseString: فَقُولَا لَهُ قَوْلًا لَيِّنًا لَعَلَّهُ يَتَذَكَّرُ أَوْ يَخْشَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: But speak to him gently. Perhaps he will be mindful, or have some fear.”

verses.verseString: قَالَا رَبَّنَا إِنَّنَا نَخَافُ أَنْ يَفْرُطَ عَلَيْنَا أَوْ أَنْ يَطْغَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: They said, “Our Lord, we fear he may persecute us, or become violent.”

verses.verseString: قَالَ لَا تَخَافَا ۖ إِنَّنِي مَعَكُمَا أَسْمَعُ وَأَرَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “Do not fear, I am with you; I hear and I see.

verses.verseString: فَأْتِيَاهُ فَقُولَا إِنَّا رَسُولَا رَبِّكَ فَأَرْسِلْ مَعَنَا بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ وَلَا تُعَذِّبْهُمْ ۖ قَدْ جِئْنَاكَ بِآيَةٍ مِنْ رَبِّكَ ۖ وَالسَّلَامُ عَلَىٰ مَنِ اتَّبَعَ الْهُدَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Approach him, and say, `We are the messengers of your Lord, so let the Children of Israel go with us, and do not torment them. We have come to you with a message from your Lord, and peace is upon whoever follows the guidance.

verses.verseString: إِنَّا قَدْ أُوحِيَ إِلَيْنَا أَنَّ الْعَذَابَ عَلَىٰ مَنْ كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ
verses.verseStringB: It was revealed to us that punishment falls upon whoever rejects and turns away.'”

verses.verseString: قَالَ فَمَنْ رَبُّكُمَا يَا مُوسَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “Who is your Lord, O Moses?”

verses.verseString: قَالَ رَبُّنَا الَّذِي أَعْطَىٰ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ خَلْقَهُ ثُمَّ هَدَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “Our Lord is He who gave everything its existence, then guided it.”

verses.verseString: قَالَ فَمَا بَالُ الْقُرُونِ الْأُولَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “What about the first generations?”

verses.verseString: قَالَ عِلْمُهَا عِنْدَ رَبِّي فِي كِتَابٍ ۖ لَا يَضِلُّ رَبِّي وَلَا يَنْسَى
verses.verseStringB: He said, “Knowledge thereof is with my Lord in a Record. My Lord never errs, nor does He forget.”

verses.verseString: الَّذِي جَعَلَ لَكُمُ الْأَرْضَ مَهْدًا وَسَلَكَ لَكُمْ فِيهَا سُبُلًا وَأَنْزَلَ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً فَأَخْرَجْنَا بِهِ أَزْوَاجًا مِنْ نَبَاتٍ شَتَّىٰ
verses.verseStringB: He who made the earth a habitat for you, and traced in it pathways for you, and sent down rain from the sky, with which We produce pairs of diverse plants.

verses.verseString: كُلُوا وَارْعَوْا أَنْعَامَكُمْ ۗ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَاتٍ لِأُولِي النُّهَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Eat and pasture your livestock. In this are signs for those possessed of sound judgment.

verses.verseString: مِنْهَا خَلَقْنَاكُمْ وَفِيهَا نُعِيدُكُمْ وَمِنْهَا نُخْرِجُكُمْ تَارَةً أُخْرَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: From it, We created you. And into it, We will return you. And from it, We will bring you out another time.

verses.verseString: وَلَقَدْ أَرَيْنَاهُ آيَاتِنَا كُلَّهَا فَكَذَّبَ وَأَبَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And We showed him Our miracles, all of them, but he denied and refused.

verses.verseString: قَالَ أَجِئْتَنَا لِتُخْرِجَنَا مِنْ أَرْضِنَا بِسِحْرِكَ يَا مُوسَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “Did you come to us to expel us from our land with your magic, O Moses?

verses.verseString: فَلَنَأْتِيَنَّكَ بِسِحْرٍ مِثْلِهِ فَاجْعَلْ بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَكَ مَوْعِدًا لَا نُخْلِفُهُ نَحْنُ وَلَا أَنْتَ مَكَانًا سُوًى
verses.verseStringB: We will produce for you magic like it. So make an appointment between us and you, at a central place, which neither we nor you will fail to keep.”

verses.verseString: قَالَ مَوْعِدُكُمْ يَوْمُ الزِّينَةِ وَأَنْ يُحْشَرَ النَّاسُ ضُحًى
verses.verseStringB: He said, “Your appointment is on the Day of the Festival, so let the people assemble before noon.”

verses.verseString: فَتَوَلَّىٰ فِرْعَوْنُ فَجَمَعَ كَيْدَهُ ثُمَّ أَتَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Pharaoh then withdrew, put together his plan, then came back.

verses.verseString: قَالَ لَهُمْ مُوسَىٰ وَيْلَكُمْ لَا تَفْتَرُوا عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا فَيُسْحِتَكُمْ بِعَذَابٍ ۖ وَقَدْ خَابَ مَنِ افْتَرَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Moses said to them, “Woe to you! Do not fabricate lies against Allah, or He will destroy you with a punishment. Whoever fabricates lies will be disappointed.”

verses.verseString: فَتَنَازَعُوا أَمْرَهُمْ بَيْنَهُمْ وَأَسَرُّوا النَّجْوَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: So they disputed the matter among themselves, conversing privately.

verses.verseString: قَالُوا إِنْ هَٰذَانِ لَسَاحِرَانِ يُرِيدَانِ أَنْ يُخْرِجَاكُمْ مِنْ أَرْضِكُمْ بِسِحْرِهِمَا وَيَذْهَبَا بِطَرِيقَتِكُمُ الْمُثْلَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: They said, “These two are magicians who want to expel you from your land with their magic, and to abolish your exemplary way of life.

verses.verseString: فَأَجْمِعُوا كَيْدَكُمْ ثُمَّ ائْتُوا صَفًّا ۚ وَقَدْ أَفْلَحَ الْيَوْمَ مَنِ اسْتَعْلَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: So settle your plan, and come as one front. Today, whoever gains the upper-hand will succeed.”

verses.verseString: قَالُوا يَا مُوسَىٰ إِمَّا أَنْ تُلْقِيَ وَإِمَّا أَنْ نَكُونَ أَوَّلَ مَنْ أَلْقَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: They said, “O Moses! Either you throw, or we will be the first to throw.”

verses.verseString: قَالَ بَلْ أَلْقُوا ۖ فَإِذَا حِبَالُهُمْ وَعِصِيُّهُمْ يُخَيَّلُ إِلَيْهِ مِنْ سِحْرِهِمْ أَنَّهَا تَسْعَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “No, you throw.” And suddenly, their ropes and their sticks appeared to him, because of their magic, to be crawling swiftly.

verses.verseString: فَأَوْجَسَ فِي نَفْسِهِ خِيفَةً مُوسَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: So Moses conceived a fear within himself.

verses.verseString: قُلْنَا لَا تَخَفْ إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ الْأَعْلَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: We said, “Do not fear! You are the uppermost.

verses.verseString: وَأَلْقِ مَا فِي يَمِينِكَ تَلْقَفْ مَا صَنَعُوا ۖ إِنَّمَا صَنَعُوا كَيْدُ سَاحِرٍ ۖ وَلَا يُفْلِحُ السَّاحِرُ حَيْثُ أَتَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Now throw what is in your right hand, and it will swallow what they have crafted. What they have crafted is only a magician’s trickery. But the magician will not succeed, wheresoever he may go.”

verses.verseString: فَأُلْقِيَ السَّحَرَةُ سُجَّدًا قَالُوا آمَنَّا بِرَبِّ هَارُونَ وَمُوسَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And the magicians fell down in prostration. They said, “We have believed in the Lord of Aaron and Moses.”

verses.verseString: قَالَ آمَنْتُمْ لَهُ قَبْلَ أَنْ آذَنَ لَكُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُ لَكَبِيرُكُمُ الَّذِي عَلَّمَكُمُ السِّحْرَ ۖ فَلَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيْدِيَكُمْ وَأَرْجُلَكُمْ مِنْ خِلَافٍ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمْ فِي جُذُوعِ النَّخْلِ وَلَتَعْلَمُنَّ أَيُّنَا أَشَدُّ عَذَابًا وَأَبْقَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “Did you believe in him before I have given you permission? He must be your master, who taught you magic. I will cut off your hands and your feet on alternate sides, and I will crucify you on the trunks of the palm-trees. Then you will know whose punishment is more severe and more lasting.”

verses.verseString: قَالُوا لَنْ نُؤْثِرَكَ عَلَىٰ مَا جَاءَنَا مِنَ الْبَيِّنَاتِ وَالَّذِي فَطَرَنَا ۖ فَاقْضِ مَا أَنْتَ قَاضٍ ۖ إِنَّمَا تَقْضِي هَٰذِهِ الْحَيَاةَ الدُّنْيَا
verses.verseStringB: They said, “We will never prefer you over the proofs that have come to us, nor over He who originated us. So issue whatever judgment you wish to issue. You can rule only in this lowly life.

verses.verseString: إِنَّا آمَنَّا بِرَبِّنَا لِيَغْفِرَ لَنَا خَطَايَانَا وَمَا أَكْرَهْتَنَا عَلَيْهِ مِنَ السِّحْرِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ خَيْرٌ وَأَبْقَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: We have believed in our Lord, so that He may forgive us our sins, and the magic you compelled us to practice. Allah is better and more Lasting.”

verses.verseString: إِنَّهُ مَنْ يَأْتِ رَبَّهُ مُجْرِمًا فَإِنَّ لَهُ جَهَنَّمَ لَا يَمُوتُ فِيهَا وَلَا يَحْيَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Whoever comes to his Lord guilty, for him is Hell, where he neither dies nor lives.

verses.verseString: وَمَنْ يَأْتِهِ مُؤْمِنًا قَدْ عَمِلَ الصَّالِحَاتِ فَأُولَٰئِكَ لَهُمُ الدَّرَجَاتُ الْعُلَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: But whoever comes to Him as a believer, having worked righteousness, theirs will be the highest ranks.

verses.verseString: جَنَّاتُ عَدْنٍ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ وَذَٰلِكَ جَزَاءُ مَنْ تَزَكَّىٰ
verses.verseStringB: The Gardens of Eden, under which rivers flow, where they will stay forever. That is the reward for whoever purifies himself.

verses.verseString: وَلَقَدْ أَوْحَيْنَا إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ أَنْ أَسْرِ بِعِبَادِي فَاضْرِبْ لَهُمْ طَرِيقًا فِي الْبَحْرِ يَبَسًا لَا تَخَافُ دَرَكًا وَلَا تَخْشَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And We inspired Moses: “Travel by night with My worshipers, and strike for them a dry path through the sea, and do not fear being overtaken, and do not worry.”

verses.verseString: فَأَتْبَعَهُمْ فِرْعَوْنُ بِجُنُودِهِ فَغَشِيَهُمْ مِنَ الْيَمِّ مَا غَشِيَهُمْ
verses.verseStringB: Pharaoh pursued them with his troops, but the sea overwhelmed them, and completely engulfed them.

verses.verseString: وَأَضَلَّ فِرْعَوْنُ قَوْمَهُ وَمَا هَدَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Pharaoh misled his people, and he did not guide them.

verses.verseString: يَا بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ قَدْ أَنْجَيْنَاكُمْ مِنْ عَدُوِّكُمْ وَوَاعَدْنَاكُمْ جَانِبَ الطُّورِ الْأَيْمَنَ وَنَزَّلْنَا عَلَيْكُمُ الْمَنَّ وَالسَّلْوَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: O Children of Israel! We saved you from your enemy, and We promised you by the right side of the Mount, and We sent down to you manna and quails.

verses.verseString: كُلُوا مِنْ طَيِّبَاتِ مَا رَزَقْنَاكُمْ وَلَا تَطْغَوْا فِيهِ فَيَحِلَّ عَلَيْكُمْ غَضَبِي ۖ وَمَنْ يَحْلِلْ عَلَيْهِ غَضَبِي فَقَدْ هَوَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Eat of the good things We have provided for you, but do not be excessive in it, lest My wrath descends upon you. He upon whom My wrath descends has fallen.

verses.verseString: وَإِنِّي لَغَفَّارٌ لِمَنْ تَابَ وَآمَنَ وَعَمِلَ صَالِحًا ثُمَّ اهْتَدَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And I am Forgiving towards whoever repents, believes, acts righteously, and then remains guided.

verses.verseString: وَمَا أَعْجَلَكَ عَنْ قَوْمِكَ يَا مُوسَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: “And what made you rush ahead of your people, O Moses?”

verses.verseString: قَالَ هُمْ أُولَاءِ عَلَىٰ أَثَرِي وَعَجِلْتُ إِلَيْكَ رَبِّ لِتَرْضَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “They are following in my footsteps. And I hurried on to You, my Lord, so that you may be pleased.”

verses.verseString: قَالَ فَإِنَّا قَدْ فَتَنَّا قَوْمَكَ مِنْ بَعْدِكَ وَأَضَلَّهُمُ السَّامِرِيُّ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “We have tested your people in your absence, and the Samarian led them astray.”

verses.verseString: فَرَجَعَ مُوسَىٰ إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِ غَضْبَانَ أَسِفًا ۚ قَالَ يَا قَوْمِ أَلَمْ يَعِدْكُمْ رَبُّكُمْ وَعْدًا حَسَنًا ۚ أَفَطَالَ عَلَيْكُمُ الْعَهْدُ أَمْ أَرَدْتُمْ أَنْ يَحِلَّ عَلَيْكُمْ غَضَبٌ مِنْ رَبِّكُمْ فَأَخْلَفْتُمْ مَوْعِدِي
verses.verseStringB: So Moses returned to his people, angry and disappointed. He said, “O my people! Did your Lord not promise you a good promise? Was time too long for you? Or did you want wrath from your Lord to descend upon you, so you broke your promise to me?”

verses.verseString: قَالُوا مَا أَخْلَفْنَا مَوْعِدَكَ بِمَلْكِنَا وَلَٰكِنَّا حُمِّلْنَا أَوْزَارًا مِنْ زِينَةِ الْقَوْمِ فَقَذَفْنَاهَا فَكَذَٰلِكَ أَلْقَى السَّامِرِيُّ
verses.verseStringB: They said, “We did not break our promise to you by our choice, but we were made to carry loads of the people’s jewelry, and we cast them in. That was what the Samarian recommended.”

verses.verseString: فَأَخْرَجَ لَهُمْ عِجْلًا جَسَدًا لَهُ خُوَارٌ فَقَالُوا هَٰذَا إِلَٰهُكُمْ وَإِلَٰهُ مُوسَىٰ فَنَسِيَ
verses.verseStringB: So he produced for them a calf—a body that lowed. And they said, “This is your god and the god of Moses, but he forgot.”

verses.verseString: أَفَلَا يَرَوْنَ أَلَّا يَرْجِعُ إِلَيْهِمْ قَوْلًا وَلَا يَمْلِكُ لَهُمْ ضَرًّا وَلَا نَفْعًا
verses.verseStringB: Have they not considered that it cannot return a word to them, and has no power to harm them or benefit them?

verses.verseString: وَلَقَدْ قَالَ لَهُمْ هَارُونُ مِنْ قَبْلُ يَا قَوْمِ إِنَّمَا فُتِنْتُمْ بِهِ ۖ وَإِنَّ رَبَّكُمُ الرَّحْمَٰنُ فَاتَّبِعُونِي وَأَطِيعُوا أَمْرِي
verses.verseStringB: Aaron had told them beforehand, “O my people, you are being tested by this, and your Lord is the Beneficent. So follow me, and obey my command.”

verses.verseString: قَالُوا لَنْ نَبْرَحَ عَلَيْهِ عَاكِفِينَ حَتَّىٰ يَرْجِعَ إِلَيْنَا مُوسَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: They said, “We will not give up our devotion to it—until Moses returns to us.”

verses.verseString: قَالَ يَا هَارُونُ مَا مَنَعَكَ إِذْ رَأَيْتَهُمْ ضَلُّوا
verses.verseStringB: He said, “O Aaron, what prevented you—when you saw them going astray.

verses.verseString: أَلَّا تَتَّبِعَنِ ۖ أَفَعَصَيْتَ أَمْرِي
verses.verseStringB: From following after me? Did you disobey my command?”

verses.verseString: قَالَ يَا ابْنَ أُمَّ لَا تَأْخُذْ بِلِحْيَتِي وَلَا بِرَأْسِي ۖ إِنِّي خَشِيتُ أَنْ تَقُولَ فَرَّقْتَ بَيْنَ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ وَلَمْ تَرْقُبْ قَوْلِي
verses.verseStringB: He said, “Son of my mother! Do not seize me by my beard or my head. I feared that you would say, `You have caused division between the Children of Israel, and did not observe my word.'”

verses.verseString: قَالَ فَمَا خَطْبُكَ يَا سَامِرِيُّ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “What do you have to say, O Samarian?”

verses.verseString: قَالَ بَصُرْتُ بِمَا لَمْ يَبْصُرُوا بِهِ فَقَبَضْتُ قَبْضَةً مِنْ أَثَرِ الرَّسُولِ فَنَبَذْتُهَا وَكَذَٰلِكَ سَوَّلَتْ لِي نَفْسِي
verses.verseStringB: He said, “I saw what they did not see, so I grabbed a handful from the Messenger’s traces, and I flung it away. Thus my soul prompted me.”

verses.verseString: قَالَ فَاذْهَبْ فَإِنَّ لَكَ فِي الْحَيَاةِ أَنْ تَقُولَ لَا مِسَاسَ ۖ وَإِنَّ لَكَ مَوْعِدًا لَنْ تُخْلَفَهُ ۖ وَانْظُرْ إِلَىٰ إِلَٰهِكَ الَّذِي ظَلْتَ عَلَيْهِ عَاكِفًا ۖ لَنُحَرِّقَنَّهُ ثُمَّ لَنَنْسِفَنَّهُ فِي الْيَمِّ نَسْفًا
verses.verseStringB: He said, “Begone! Your lot in this life is to say, ‘No contact.’ And you have an appointment that you will not miss. Now, look at your god, to whom you remained devoted: we will burn it up, then scatter it in the sea, completely.”

verses.verseString: إِنَّمَا إِلَٰهُكُمُ اللَّهُ الَّذِي لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۚ وَسِعَ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ عِلْمًا
verses.verseStringB: Your God is Allah, the One besides whom there is no other god. He encompasses all things in knowledge.

verses.verseString: كَذَٰلِكَ نَقُصُّ عَلَيْكَ مِنْ أَنْبَاءِ مَا قَدْ سَبَقَ ۚ وَقَدْ آتَيْنَاكَ مِنْ لَدُنَّا ذِكْرًا
verses.verseStringB: Thus We narrate to you reports of times gone by. And We have given you a Reminder from Our Presence.

verses.verseString: مَنْ أَعْرَضَ عَنْهُ فَإِنَّهُ يَحْمِلُ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ وِزْرًا
verses.verseStringB: Whoever turns away from it will carry on the Day of Resurrection a burden.

verses.verseString: خَالِدِينَ فِيهِ ۖ وَسَاءَ لَهُمْ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ حِمْلًا
verses.verseStringB: Abiding in it forever. Evil is their burden on the Day of Resurrection.

verses.verseString: يَوْمَ يُنْفَخُ فِي الصُّورِ ۚ وَنَحْشُرُ الْمُجْرِمِينَ يَوْمَئِذٍ زُرْقًا
verses.verseStringB: On the Day when the Trumpet is blown—We will gather the criminals on that Day, blue.

verses.verseString: يَتَخَافَتُونَ بَيْنَهُمْ إِنْ لَبِثْتُمْ إِلَّا عَشْرًا
verses.verseStringB: Murmuring among themselves: “You have lingered only for ten.”

verses.verseString: نَحْنُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يَقُولُونَ إِذْ يَقُولُ أَمْثَلُهُمْ طَرِيقَةً إِنْ لَبِثْتُمْ إِلَّا يَوْمًا
verses.verseStringB: We are fully aware of what they say—when the most exemplary of them in conduct will say, “You have lingered only a day.”

verses.verseString: وَيَسْأَلُونَكَ عَنِ الْجِبَالِ فَقُلْ يَنْسِفُهَا رَبِّي نَسْفًا
verses.verseStringB: And they ask you about the mountains. Say, “My Lord will pulverize them, utterly.

verses.verseString: فَيَذَرُهَا قَاعًا صَفْصَفًا
verses.verseStringB: And reduce them into a desolate waste.

verses.verseString: لَا تَرَىٰ فِيهَا عِوَجًا وَلَا أَمْتًا
verses.verseStringB: You will see in them neither dip nor elevation.”

verses.verseString: يَوْمَئِذٍ يَتَّبِعُونَ الدَّاعِيَ لَا عِوَجَ لَهُ ۖ وَخَشَعَتِ الْأَصْوَاتُ لِلرَّحْمَٰنِ فَلَا تَسْمَعُ إِلَّا هَمْسًا
verses.verseStringB: On that Day, they will follow the Caller, without any deviation. Voices will be hushed before the Merciful, and you will hear nothing but murmur.

verses.verseString: يَوْمَئِذٍ لَا تَنْفَعُ الشَّفَاعَةُ إِلَّا مَنْ أَذِنَ لَهُ الرَّحْمَٰنُ وَرَضِيَ لَهُ قَوْلًا
verses.verseStringB: On that Day, mediation will be of no benefit, except for someone permitted by the Gracious, and whose words He has approved.

verses.verseString: يَعْلَمُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُمْ وَلَا يُحِيطُونَ بِهِ عِلْمًا
verses.verseStringB: He knows what is ahead of them, and what is behind them, and they cannot encompass Him in their knowledge.

verses.verseString: وَعَنَتِ الْوُجُوهُ لِلْحَيِّ الْقَيُّومِ ۖ وَقَدْ خَابَ مَنْ حَمَلَ ظُلْمًا
verses.verseStringB: Faces will be humbled before the Living, the Eternal. Whoever carries injustice will despair.

verses.verseString: وَمَنْ يَعْمَلْ مِنَ الصَّالِحَاتِ وَهُوَ مُؤْمِنٌ فَلَا يَخَافُ ظُلْمًا وَلَا هَضْمًا
verses.verseStringB: But whoever has done righteous deeds, while being a believer—will fear neither wrong nor grievance.

verses.verseString: وَكَذَٰلِكَ أَنْزَلْنَاهُ قُرْآنًا عَرَبِيًّا وَصَرَّفْنَا فِيهِ مِنَ الْوَعِيدِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَّقُونَ أَوْ يُحْدِثُ لَهُمْ ذِكْرًا
verses.verseStringB: Thus We revealed it an Arabic Quran, and We diversified the warnings in it, so perhaps they will become righteous, or it produces a lesson for them.

verses.verseString: فَتَعَالَى اللَّهُ الْمَلِكُ الْحَقُّ ۗ وَلَا تَعْجَلْ بِالْقُرْآنِ مِنْ قَبْلِ أَنْ يُقْضَىٰ إِلَيْكَ وَحْيُهُ ۖ وَقُلْ رَبِّ زِدْنِي عِلْمًا
verses.verseStringB: So Exalted is Allah, the True Sovereign. Do not be hasty with the Quran before its inspiration is concluded to you, and say, “My Lord, increase me in knowledge.”

verses.verseString: وَلَقَدْ عَهِدْنَا إِلَىٰ آدَمَ مِنْ قَبْلُ فَنَسِيَ وَلَمْ نَجِدْ لَهُ عَزْمًا
verses.verseStringB: And We covenanted with Adam before, but he forgot, and We found in him no resolve.

verses.verseString: وَإِذْ قُلْنَا لِلْمَلَائِكَةِ اسْجُدُوا لِآدَمَ فَسَجَدُوا إِلَّا إِبْلِيسَ أَبَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And when We said to the angels: “Prostrate yourselves before Adam.” They prostrated, except for Iblis—he refused.

verses.verseString: فَقُلْنَا يَا آدَمُ إِنَّ هَٰذَا عَدُوٌّ لَكَ وَلِزَوْجِكَ فَلَا يُخْرِجَنَّكُمَا مِنَ الْجَنَّةِ فَتَشْقَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: We said, “O Adam, this is an enemy to you and to your wife. So let him not drive you out of Paradise, for then you will suffer.

verses.verseString: إِنَّ لَكَ أَلَّا تَجُوعَ فِيهَا وَلَا تَعْرَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: In it, you will never go hungry, nor go naked.

verses.verseString: وَأَنَّكَ لَا تَظْمَأُ فِيهَا وَلَا تَضْحَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Nor will you be thirsty in it, nor will you swelter.”

verses.verseString: فَوَسْوَسَ إِلَيْهِ الشَّيْطَانُ قَالَ يَا آدَمُ هَلْ أَدُلُّكَ عَلَىٰ شَجَرَةِ الْخُلْدِ وَمُلْكٍ لَا يَبْلَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: But Satan whispered to him. He said, “O Adam, shall I show you the Tree of Everlastingness and a kingdom that never decays?”

verses.verseString: فَأَكَلَا مِنْهَا فَبَدَتْ لَهُمَا سَوْآتُهُمَا وَطَفِقَا يَخْصِفَانِ عَلَيْهِمَا مِنْ وَرَقِ الْجَنَّةِ ۚ وَعَصَىٰ آدَمُ رَبَّهُ فَغَوَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And so they ate from it, and their nakedness became exposed to them, and they began covering themselves with the leaves of the Garden. Adam disobeyed his Lord, and so became misled.

verses.verseString: ثُمَّ اجْتَبَاهُ رَبُّهُ فَتَابَ عَلَيْهِ وَهَدَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: But then his Lord recalled him, pardoned him, and guided him.

verses.verseString: قَالَ اهْبِطَا مِنْهَا جَمِيعًا ۖ بَعْضُكُمْ لِبَعْضٍ عَدُوٌّ ۖ فَإِمَّا يَأْتِيَنَّكُمْ مِنِّي هُدًى فَمَنِ اتَّبَعَ هُدَايَ فَلَا يَضِلُّ وَلَا يَشْقَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “Descend from it, all together, some of you enemies of others. But whenever guidance comes to you from Me, whoever follows My guidance, will neither go astray nor suffer.

verses.verseString: وَمَنْ أَعْرَضَ عَنْ ذِكْرِي فَإِنَّ لَهُ مَعِيشَةً ضَنْكًا وَنَحْشُرُهُ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ أَعْمَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: But whoever turns away from My remembrance, for him is a confined life, and We will raise him on the Day of Resurrection blind.”

verses.verseString: قَالَ رَبِّ لِمَ حَشَرْتَنِي أَعْمَىٰ وَقَدْ كُنْتُ بَصِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: He will say, “My Lord, why did You raise me blind, although I was seeing?”

verses.verseString: قَالَ كَذَٰلِكَ أَتَتْكَ آيَاتُنَا فَنَسِيتَهَا ۖ وَكَذَٰلِكَ الْيَوْمَ تُنْسَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: He will say, “Just as Our revelations came to you, and you forgot them, so today you will be forgotten.”

verses.verseString: وَكَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي مَنْ أَسْرَفَ وَلَمْ يُؤْمِنْ بِآيَاتِ رَبِّهِ ۚ وَلَعَذَابُ الْآخِرَةِ أَشَدُّ وَأَبْقَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Thus We repay whoever transgresses and does not believe in the revelations of his Lord. The punishment of the Hereafter is more severe and more lasting.

verses.verseString: أَفَلَمْ يَهْدِ لَهُمْ كَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُمْ مِنَ الْقُرُونِ يَمْشُونَ فِي مَسَاكِنِهِمْ ۗ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَاتٍ لِأُولِي النُّهَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Does it not serve as guidance for them, how many generations We destroyed before them, in whose settlements they walk? Surely in this are signs for those of sound judgment.

verses.verseString: وَلَوْلَا كَلِمَةٌ سَبَقَتْ مِنْ رَبِّكَ لَكَانَ لِزَامًا وَأَجَلٌ مُسَمًّى
verses.verseStringB: Were it not for a prior Word from your Lord, and an appointed term, it would have been necessary.

verses.verseString: فَاصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ قَبْلَ طُلُوعِ الشَّمْسِ وَقَبْلَ غُرُوبِهَا ۖ وَمِنْ آنَاءِ اللَّيْلِ فَسَبِّحْ وَأَطْرَافَ النَّهَارِ لَعَلَّكَ تَرْضَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: So bear patiently what they say, and celebrate your Lord’s praises before the rising of the sun, and before its setting, and during the hours of the night glorify Him, and at the borders of the day, so that you may be content.

verses.verseString: وَلَا تَمُدَّنَّ عَيْنَيْكَ إِلَىٰ مَا مَتَّعْنَا بِهِ أَزْوَاجًا مِنْهُمْ زَهْرَةَ الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا لِنَفْتِنَهُمْ فِيهِ ۚ وَرِزْقُ رَبِّكَ خَيْرٌ وَأَبْقَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And do not extend your glance towards what We have given some classes of them to enjoy—the flower of this life—so that We may test them thereby. But your Lord’s provision is better and more lasting.

verses.verseString: وَأْمُرْ أَهْلَكَ بِالصَّلَاةِ وَاصْطَبِرْ عَلَيْهَا ۖ لَا نَسْأَلُكَ رِزْقًا ۖ نَحْنُ نَرْزُقُكَ ۗ وَالْعَاقِبَةُ لِلتَّقْوَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And exhort your people to pray, and patiently adhere to it. We ask of you no sustenance, but it is We who sustain you. And the end belongs to reverence.

verses.verseString: وَقَالُوا لَوْلَا يَأْتِينَا بِآيَةٍ مِنْ رَبِّهِ ۚ أَوَلَمْ تَأْتِهِمْ بَيِّنَةُ مَا فِي الصُّحُفِ الْأُولَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And they say, “If only he would bring us a miracle from his Lord.” Were they not given enough clear proofs in the former scriptures?

verses.verseString: وَلَوْ أَنَّا أَهْلَكْنَاهُمْ بِعَذَابٍ مِنْ قَبْلِهِ لَقَالُوا رَبَّنَا لَوْلَا أَرْسَلْتَ إِلَيْنَا رَسُولًا فَنَتَّبِعَ آيَاتِكَ مِنْ قَبْلِ أَنْ نَذِلَّ وَنَخْزَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Had We destroyed them with a punishment before this, they would have said, “Our Lord, if only You had sent us a messenger, we would have followed Your revelations before being humiliated and disgraced.”

verses.verseString: قُلْ كُلٌّ مُتَرَبِّصٌ فَتَرَبَّصُوا ۖ فَسَتَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ أَصْحَابُ الصِّرَاطِ السَّوِيِّ وَمَنِ اهْتَدَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Say, “Everyone is waiting, so wait. You will know who the people of the sound path are, and who is guided.”
